etymology.description: 汽 (steam; gas) + 水 (water) = carbonated/sparkling water.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “vapor-water,” evoking water infused with gas and bubbles. In many contexts it can refer broadly to carbonated drinks, while in others it specifically means sparkling water; context clarifies.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝冰镇汽水(我喜歡喝冰鎮汽水)。
examples.english: I like to drink chilled sparkling water.

examples.chinese: 你想要纯净水还是汽水(你想要純淨水還是汽水)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng yào chúnjìng shuǐ háishì qìshuǐ.
examples.english: Do you want still water or sparkling water?

examples.chinese: 这种汽水没有味道(這種汽水沒有味道)，只有气泡(只有氣泡)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng qìshuǐ méiyǒu wèidào, zhǐyǒu qìpào.
examples.english: This sparkling water has no flavor, only bubbles.
